title: Skyrim "Hard-Lore Enhanced" mod pack
description:
Skyrim "Hard-Lore Enhanced" mod pack
This pack brings you about 60-70 mods. Sorry for those who want it all already installed and working... but in no way I'm gonna zip and upload 14gb of data.
This modding pack has been tested and runs pretty much flawlessly in my Skyrim game (I recommend a new game, just to make sure it won't CTD). I didn't have time to checked all the stuff installed so I can't promise won't be anything missing... but so far runs well.
Also I've chosen each mod to make sure nothing overlaps and, in case something does overlaps, it's unimportant.
Each mod is up-to-date to 08/15/2013 (too lazy to go around looking for each mod version, sorry).
NOTE: This mod package is NOT aimed for better graphics, but getting a better experience adding immersion and harshness to the world. It does include some mods for better female textures, such as Caliente's and others like that.

This package requires:
- Skyrim with 3 DLCs (Dawnguard, Hearthfire and Dragonborn) with update version 1.9.32.0.8 (RELOADED update 13). At least that's how I play it. I can't say if it really needs DB expansion or HF or DG...

This package includes:
- Skyrim folder to "My Games" folder.
- Skyrim folder to "AppDataLocal" folder.
- Nexus Mod Manager
- TE5Edit (for checking correct mods load order)
- My own LoadOrder file exported from NMM (checked and currently running flawlessly)
- Around 60-70 mods aimed to make Skyrim a harsher world to survive, yet to retain its original ambience AND enhance the gaming experience polishing details I considered were left unfinished, trying to make it more realistic. No more "Is that a bandit camp? That's no match for my lvl 1 altmer warrior!"... I wouldn't advice you to challenge even a pack of wolves from start.
ANOTHER NOTE: if you're wondering how to install it... the important things are numbered as how I installed them. Concerning those which aren't numbered, I left some notes for those who need an specific order to run well. Keep in mind I'm no programmer, so if I can do it, any regular modded Skyrim player can.

I realize 70 mods is quite a lot to run. Yet it is possible. Next are my system specs, so I don't want to hear anything like "Oy! I'll need a new rig to run this stuff!" or anything like that:

- Keep in mind it's a laptop, so if you have a desktop computer with similar specs, you have NO excuse.
- Intel Core I3 M380 2.53 GHz
- 3 GB RAM
- GeForce Nvidia 310M

Skyrim graphic config used goes:
Antialiasing: Off

Anisotropic Filtering: Off

Texture Quality: Medium

Radial Blur Quality: Low

Shadow Detail: Low

Decal Quantity: Medium

FXAA: Off

Water: Reflect Sky

Distant Object Detail: Low

View Distance: 2-2-0-2 (left row) and 2-1 (right row)

Object Detail Fade: On

Yeah, that's pretty much running on lowest, but as said I'm running it on a laptop and as long as it goes just fine, I'm peachy with that.
